oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cavalry charge at Hanging Rock
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Print featuring the charge of cavalry on the British hollow square at Hanging Rock. Soliders wearing blue on horseback on the left. Soliders wearing red on foot with bayonets on right. Bodies laying in the foreground. American flag in the background. Attack on the Hollow Square at Hanging Rock
A battle of the Revolutionary War fought on August 6, 1780 in South Carolina, where Carolina militia defeated British troops. A young Andrew Jackson is thought to have participated in the battle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sumter, Thomas, 1734-1832;United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Atlas of famous battles of the American Revolution
